Body: Possible Duplicate:  Can we use an Android phone as a Wi-Fi repeater?  I have my home router which for a variety of reasons I can not switch to WEP. However, I occasionally need to use my Nintendo DS to connect to Nintendo WFC, and it can only use a WEP connection. My current method is to use the Wi-Fi Hotspot feature of my HTC Desire HD to create a temporary WEP network and connect to that using my DS. This is fine, except it forces my phone to use my carrier's data connection instead of my home wireless network, bringing with it associated charges if I hadn't used the internet on my phone that day already.Is there anyway to share a wireless network instead of the mobile network via the Wi-Fi Hotspot feature?
